channel.title: BBC News - Home

item.title: Meghan accuses palace of 'perpetuating falsehoods'
item.description: The Duchess of Sussex says she does not know how Buckingham Palace could expect her to "be silent".

item.title: Prince Philip has successful heart procedure, palace says
item.description: The Duke of Edinburgh will remain in hospital for a number of days, Buckingham Palace says.

item.title: Budget 2021: Rishi Sunak insists Covid-recovery tax rises fair
item.description: Chancellor Rishi Sunak is accused of hitting the poorest hardest in his Budget plan to balance the books.

item.title: Covid: Germany approves AstraZeneca vaccine for over-65s
item.description: The decision comes after Chancellor Merkel said data showed the jab was effective for the elderly too.

item.title: Women retirees win £2.7bn for underpaid pensions
item.description: About 200,000 pensions may get top-ups averaging £13,500 after nearly two decades of shortfalls.

item.title: Phone-hacking: Noel Fielding among latest celebrities to accept damages
item.description: Owners of a now-defunct tabloid apologise for distress caused by illegally intercepting voicemails.

item.title: US Capitol police warn of possible militia plot to breach Congress
item.description: A session is cancelled because of "potential threats" from a militia to storm the Congress building.

item.title: Apple investigated in UK over 'unfair' App Store claims
item.description: The Competition and Markets Authority has launched an investigation into how Apple's app store is run.

item.title: Sweden attack: Seven injured in stabbings in Vetlanda
item.description: Police are treating the case as attempted murder and have now ruled out terrorism.

item.title: US suspends tariffs on single malt Scotch whisky
item.description: The suspension, which includes other goods, covers tariffs that were imposed in a row over Airbus subsidies.

item.title: Mariah Carey's brother sues over emotional distress caused by her memoir
item.description: The star's older brother, Morgan Carey, accuses the star of "malicious falsehoods" in her memoir.

item.title: Abbey Road sign sells at auction for £37,000
item.description: The road will forever be associated with Britain's most successful musical export - The Beatles.

item.title: Alec Baldwin deactivates Twitter account over 'switching accents' joke
item.description: The actor made light of a recent controversy surrounding the heritage of his wife, Hilaria.

item.title: SpaceX: Starship lands safely... then explodes
item.description: It is the first time Elon Musk's space exploration company has pulled off this difficult landing.

item.title: The 'vaccine hunters' helping older people get Covid jabs
item.description: Americans baffled by the complex system for getting a shot now have help from tech-savvy young people.

item.title: Louvre reunited with 'exceptional' armour stolen in 1983
item.description: The helmet and breastplate were discovered by an antiquities expert in Bordeaux.

item.title: Life discovered deep beneath an Antarctic ice sheet 'shouldn't be there'
item.description: Researchers hoping to collect mud samples deep beneath an Antarctic ice sheet were amazed to discover small creatures living in the dark, freezing water.

item.title: Budget 2021: 'I'm finding it hard to celebrate'
item.description: There's more support for many in the Budget, but for some it still falls short.

item.title: Ryan Thomas quits acting after 'losing the bug for it'
item.description: The former Coronation Street star says he was tired of being rejected for roles and of online trolls.

item.title: Reddit chief: I was late to spot GameStop stock mania
item.description: Steve Huffman says he supported the aims of a Reddit group taking on the hedge funds.

item.title: The Papers: 'Spend now, tax later Budget' and 'war at palace'
item.description: The papers focus on the Budget and the investigation into claims the Duchess of Sussex bullied royal staff.

item.title: London Euston cat-astrophe averted for train-surfing puss
item.description: A cat avoided almost certain death after it was spotted on the roof of a high speed train before it departed.

item.title: Why are QAnon believers obsessed with 4 March?
item.description: Believers are using an old, irrelevant law to herald the supposed return to power of Donald Trump.

item.title: 'After the first cancellation it didn't go back to normal'
item.description: The so-called sharing economy has been greatly affected by the continuing Covid-19 pandemic.

item.title: Argentina: Can one country's change of abortion law alter a continent?
item.description: Pro-choice activists hope Argentina's legalisation of abortion will bring about change elsewhere.

item.title: India Supreme Court: Calls for Justice Sharad Bobde to quit over rape remarks
item.description: Calls are growing in India for Chief Justice Sharad Bobde to resign over his "atrocious" remarks.

item.title: Girl In Red: 'I'm a genre-free artist. Open to everything'
item.description: How the singer went from making "queer pop" in her bedroom to working with Billie Eilish's brother.

item.title: Then and now: A 'megadrought' in California
item.description: See how extreme weather has affected an vital reservoir in California.

item.title: LeBron James: NBA superstar's evolution from high school prodigy
item.description: This is the story of LeBron James, the high school phenomenon who turned three failing franchises into NBA-winning teams.

item.title: England's batting fails again in India
item.description: England's batsmen once again fail to deliver on the first day of the final Test against India in Ahmedabad.

item.title: Kieran Hardy: Wales scrum-half ruled out of Six Nations
item.description: Wales scrum-half Kieran Hardy is ruled out of the rest of the Six Nations by the hamstring he injured in the Triple Crown win against England.

item.title: Glasgow and Dublin at growing risk of losing Euro 2020 games
item.description: Glasgow and Dublin are at growing risk of being cut from the list of host cities for this summer's European Championship.

item.title: Curtis Jones: Liverpool's 'streetwise' youngster with 'unusual belief'
item.description: It may feel at times like little has gone right for Liverpool this season but the rise of local boy Curtis Jones has provided a much-needed spark.

item.title: I never had a goal drought like this, says Chelsea's Werner
item.description: Chelsea forward Timo Werner says there is more to come from him after admitting he has never experienced a goal drought like this season.

item.title: Deese Kasinga: What happens when the Premier League academy dream dies?
item.description: Only 180 of the 1.5 million youth football players in England will make it to the Premier League. So what happens to the rest?

item.title: Is there help for homeowners in arrears? And other Budget questions
item.description: Budget questions from readers on a range of topics.

item.title: Budget 2021: 10 ways Rishi Sunak's speech affects you
item.description: Chancellor Rishi Sunak's Budget is packed with policies that will affect your finances. Here is a guide.

item.title: Budget 2021: What is levelling up and how is it going?
item.description: Levelling up was one of the themes of the chancellor's Budget.

item.title: Freeports: What are they and where will they be?
item.description: The government says the low-tax zones will boost struggling parts of the UK, but not everyone agrees.

item.title: Five things we learnt from the Budget
item.description: The BBC's Jonathan Blake takes us through the big things that stood out from this year's Budget.

item.title: Budget 2021: Key points at-a-glance
item.description: Rishi Sunak has delivered his annual Budget in the House of Commons. Here's what you need to know.

item.title: How do we know Covid vaccines are safe?
item.description: Busting myths and explaining the facts around vaccines.

item.title: What's the roadmap for lifting lockdown?
item.description: The prime minister has announced a plan for how the lockdown will be lifted in England.

item.title: Covid: How many people get self-isolation payments?
item.description: Figures for England and Wales suggest two-thirds of people who ask for self-isolation payments get rejected.

item.title: Covid: When will I get the vaccine?
item.description: Two approved Covid vaccines are being rolled out across the UK. So when might you get one?

item.title: What are the new rules for testing and hotel quarantine?
item.description: Travellers going to and from the UK face a growing number of restrictions.

item.title: Lockdown Learning: What educational resources are on TV, iPlayer and online?
item.description: As schools remain closed to most pupils, the BBC is offering a wealth of educational material.
